      • isDouble

        public static boolean isDouble(java.lang.String value)
        Checks whether the given String value is a parsable double.
        Parameters:
        value -
        Returns:
        true if parses, otherwise false

      • requireElementFound

        public static <T> T requireElementFound(T obj)
                                 throws ElementNotFoundException
        Checks that the specified object reference is not null. This method is designed primarily for doing parameter validation in AbstractNoNullList methods and constructors, as demonstrated below: 
         public Foo(Bar bar) {
     this.bar = requireElementFound(bar);
 }
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the reference
        Parameters:
        obj - the object reference to check for nullity
        Returns:
        obj if not null
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if obj is null
        ElementNotFoundException

      • requireNotEmpty

        public static java.lang.String requireNotEmpty(java.lang.String str)
        Checks that the specified string reference is not null and after String.trim()., that it is not empty String.isEmpty(). This method is designed primarily for doing parameter validation in methods and constructors, as demonstrated below: 
         public Foo(string bar) {
     this.bar = requireNotEmpty(bar);
 }
        Parameters:
        str - the string reference to check for nullity
        Returns:
        a trimmed copy of str if not null and not empty
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if str is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the trimmed str is empty

      • requireGreaterOrEqual

        public static int requireGreaterOrEqual(int value,
                                        int min)
        Return value if the value is greater than or equals min value.
        Parameters:
        value - the integer to be tested
        min - used in comparison to value
        Returns:
        value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if supplied value is less than min
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the supplied value is null

      • requireBigDecimalParseable

        public static java.lang.String requireBigDecimalParseable(java.lang.String value)
        Checks to make sure that the string value can be parsed as a double and can construct a BigDecimal. The returned value will be rounded up to 2 dp.
        Parameters:
        value - A string representation of a double
        Returns:
        A formatted representation of value, rounded up to 2 dp
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if value is !isDouble
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the value is null
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if value is not a valid representation

      • print

        public static <T> void print(T obj)
        Print an object. The string produced by the String.valueOf(Object) method is translated into bytes according to the platform's default character encoding, and these bytes are written in exactly the manner of the PrintStream.write(int) method.
        Type Parameters:
        T -
        Parameters:
        obj - The Object to be printed
        See Also:
        Object.toString()

      • println

        public static <T> void println(T obj)
        Print an Object and then terminate the line. This method calls at first String.valueOf(x) to get the printed object's string value, then behaves as though it invokes PrintStream.print(String) and then PrintStream.println().
        Type Parameters:
        T -
        Parameters:
        obj - The Object to be printed.

      • println

        public static void println()
        Terminates the current line by writing the line separator string. The line separator string is defined by the system property line.separator, and is not necessarily a single newline character ('\n').

      • printlnBackOption

        public static void printlnBackOption()
        Prints a String "b: Back" and then terminate the line.

      • printlnExitOption

        public static void printlnExitOption()
        Prints a String "x: Exit" and then terminate the line.

      • printlnLineSpaced

        public static <T> void printlnLineSpaced(T obj)
        Prints a String and then terminate the line. This method behaves as though it invokes println() and then println(java.lang.Object) and then println().
        Type Parameters:
        T -
        Parameters:
        obj - The String to be printed.

      • getInput

        public static java.lang.String getInput(java.lang.String text)
        Constructs a new Scanner that produces values scanned from the specified input stream. Bytes from the stream are converted into characters using the underlying platform's default charset. The input stream to be scanned is System.in The text provided will have ": " appended, and will be displayed before the input cursor of Scanner
        Parameters:
        text - Will be printed directly before the input cursor
        Returns:
        the current line, excluding any line separator at the end.

      • getInputLowerCase

        public static java.lang.String getInputLowerCase(java.lang.String text)
        Just like getInput except the returned input is converted to lower case.
        Parameters:
        text -
        Returns:
        the current line in lower case, excluding any line separator at the end.

      • getInputUpperCase

        public static java.lang.String getInputUpperCase(java.lang.String text)
        Just like getInput except the returned input is converted to upper case.
        Parameters:
        text -
        Returns:
        the current line in upper case, excluding any line separator at the end.

      • getChoice

        public static java.lang.String getChoice()
        Just like getInputLowerCase except the text use is "Choice", and makes this ideal for choosing menu options.
        Returns:
        the current line in lower case, excluding any line separator at the end.

      • getRequireNotEmpty

        public static java.lang.String getRequireNotEmpty(java.lang.String text)
        Just like getInput apart from an exception will be thrown if the input is empty. as determined by requireNotEmpty
        Parameters:
        text -
        Returns:
        the current line, excluding any line separator at the end.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no line was empty

      • getInputInt

        public static int getInputInt(java.lang.String text)
        Just like getRequireNotEmpty apart from the returned value is parsed to an integer value.
        Parameters:
        text -
        Returns:
        the current line parsed as an integer.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no line was empty
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the line could not be integer parsed

      • getLocalDate

        public static java.time.LocalDate getLocalDate(java.lang.String text)
        Just like getRequireNotEmpty apart from the returned value is parsed to a LocalDate.
        Parameters:
        text - IS0 8601 formatted date, yyyy-MM-dd
        Returns:
        the current line parsed as a LocalDate.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no line was empty
        java.time.format.DateTimeParseException - if the line could not be parsed

      • getLocalTime

        public static java.time.LocalTime getLocalTime(java.lang.String text)
        Just like getRequireNotEmpty apart from the returned value is parsed to a LocalTime.
        Parameters:
        text - IS0 8601 formatted time, HH:mm:ss
        Returns:
        the current line parsed as a LocalTime.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no line was empty
        java.time.format.DateTimeParseException - if the line could not be parsed

      • getLocalDateTime

        public static java.time.LocalDateTime getLocalDateTime(java.lang.String text)
        Just like getLocalDate apart from the returned value is parsed to a LocalDateTime.
        Parameters:
        text - IS0 8601 formatted date, yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss (T is the separator)
        Returns:
        the current line parsed as an integer.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no line was empty
        java.time.format.DateTimeParseException - if the line could not be parsed

      • getPrice

        public static Price getPrice(java.lang.String text)
        Get a Price from input.
        Parameters:
        text - IS0 8601 formatted date, yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss (T is the separator)
        Returns:
        the current line parsed as a Price
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if value is !isDouble
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the value is null
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if value is not a valid

      • getGender

        public static GenderTypes getGender()
        Just like getInputLowerCase except the returned input is converted to GenderTypes.
        Returns:
        The current line as a GenderTypes
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if option is invalid

        public static ProductClassTypes getProductClass()
        Just like getInputLowerCase except the returned input is converted to ProductClassTypes.
        Returns:

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if option is invalid
